dmca.title: Williams copywriting inquiry
dmca.body:
Hello Emma,

I'm writing this letter to inform you that my legal team has spotted
blatant plagiarisim of our site CreativePurrsuits.com by
Williamscopywriting.co.uk. We take this very seriously and without fail we
do follow up on any instances of such plagiarisim.

We have gathered screenshots of all pages concerned and have proof that
this intellectual property was created years before it was copied and
posted on the blog of Williams Copywriting Co. in the UK.

The link or URL to the page on hiring, also contains copy stolen from
Creative Purrsuits.com.

We are hoping that we may resolve this issue amicably by removing all
content that has been copied. We have researched and found over 80
phrases, etc. that have been duplicated. In fact, the entire front page of
Creative Purrsuits was copied and pasted onto the following pages. And you
used stolen words in your url.

82x2pages of words matching Creative Purrsuits text, as highlighted below
by Copyscape.

http://www.williamscopywriting.co.uk/blog/category/copywriter-uk/

http://www.williamscopywriting.co.uk/blog/copywriters/2006/06/25/
is-the-writing-part-of-doing-business-a-problem-for-you-hire-a-professional-free
lance-copywriter-in-uk.html


As you are well aware, this is a infringement of the Digital Millenium
Copyright Act (http://www.google.com/dmca.html) and if the situation is
not resolved by April 22, 2008, we will have no other recourse but to file
a DMCA infringement with sites such as Google, and others, to have the
offending site removed from their search results.

We also have a list of your clients and directories where your links
appear, as well as the information on your Internet Service Provider. We
will begin on April 23, 2008 to notify all parties of your act of
plagiarism if you do not remove the material taken from
http://www.creativepurrsuits.com immediately.

As competitors, I'm sure you would agree that there is an abundance of
Work out there for us all and you must realize that you should certainly
not be advertising a copywriting site or blog by using content stolen from
another copywriter. The least you can do to prove your talent in this
business is to write "Original" content for your site. Thank you for your
time and help and understanding in this matter.


Regards,
Judy Brown
Creative Purrsuits.com
Yale, BC Canada
http://www.creativepurrsuits.com
dmca.principal_name: Judy Brown - Creative Purrsuits Writing Services
